title: Scared to drive on the motorway
text: [news] Yesterday (10:28) I think one issue which is not being mentioned enough and which desperately needs to be drummed into those first venturing onto motorways and dual carriageways is that a bit of speed is your friend; one of the most dangerous things you can do is either drive too slowly or brake unnecessarily.Other vehicles are on the look out for big slow things; trucks and vans, but not little slow things and you can easily get ploughed into.The other thing I firmly believe is that there are some smaller cars that are so unsuitable for motorways that they should actually be banned from them. I've seen tow serious accidents where those short, narrow and tall style of city cars have been flipped around in high winds, amplified by the draught from HGVs.
